info.name: Architect SDK API
info.description:
Configuration-driven REST API: common, config ingestion, and entity CRUD endpoints.

Every table automatically has created_at, updated_at, and archived_at (timestamptz). created_at/updated_at default to NOW(); updated_at is set to NOW() on every update; archived_at is for soft-delete.

request.description: Readiness check (includes DB). Returns 200 if ready, 503 if degraded.

formdata.description: Zip file containing manifest.json at root (must include 'schema', the PostgreSQL schema name used by all configs) plus enums.json, tables.json, columns.json, indexes.json, relationships.json, api_entities.json. No schemas.json needed.

request.description: Upload a module zip. Zip must have manifest.json (id, name, version, schema) at root and config JSON files. The manifest's 'schema' is the PostgreSQL schema name used for all configs; no separate schemas table or schema_id in each config. Applies all configs in order and stores manifest in _sys_modules.
Every table gets created_at, updated_at, and archived_at (timestamptz) added automatically; omit them from config unless you need custom definitions.

body.raw:
[
  {
    "id": "col_users_id",
    "table_id": "tbl_users",
    "name": "id",
    "type": "uuid",
    "nullable": false,
    "default": {"expression": "gen_random_uuid()"},
    "comment": null
  },
  {
    "id": "col_users_email",
    "table_id": "tbl_users",
    "name": "email",
    "type": "varchar(255)",
    "nullable": false,
    "default": null,
    "comment": null
  },
  {
    "id": "col_orders_id",
    "table_id": "tbl_orders",
    "name": "id",
    "type": "bigserial",
    "nullable": false,
    "default": null,
    "comment": null
  },
  {
    "id": "col_orders_user_id",
    "table_id": "tbl_orders",
    "name": "user_id",
    "type": "uuid",
    "nullable": false,
    "default": null,
    "comment": "References users.id"
  },
  {
    "id": "col_orders_status",
    "table_id": "tbl_orders",
    "name": "status",
    "type": "public.order_status",
    "nullable": false,
    "default": "'pending'",
    "comment": null
  }
]

request.description: List all users. Optional query filters: any column name = value (e.g. email=user@example.com). Use limit and offset for paging.
id, created_at, updated_at, and archived_at are set by the server; send only email (and optional id if overriding default).
Set user_id variable from a created user's id.
List all orders. Optional filters: status, user_id, etc. limit/offset for paging.
user_id and status in body. id, created_at, updated_at, archived_at are set by the server.

item.name: Sample (module: sample)
item.description: Module-scoped entity API for the sample module (users, orders). Uses /api/v1/module/sample/:path_segment. Install the sample module zip first.

item.name: Sample E-commerce (module: sample_ecommerce)
item.description: Module-scoped entity API for sample_ecommerce (organizations, users, customers, addresses, warehouses, products, orders, payments, inventory). Install the ecommerce module zip first. Create an organization and set the organization_id collection variable for most requests.
